title: How to Paint a Chair Rail

steps.headline: Inspect the chair rail molding you wish to paint to determine whether it is wood, composite, or plaster.
Repair any damaged areas in the chair rail with the appropriate repair product.
steps.description: For example, wood chair rail nicks may be filled with wood filler product and sanded until smooth. Plaster chair rails may require the services of a professional for repair.

steps.headline: Clean and dry the chair rail.
Choose a color of paint for the chair rail and for the walls to give a room a whole new look.
steps.description: Take into account the color of the crown molding and baseboard to create a cohesive look. Darker colors are often painted below the chair rail to ground the room. Lighter colors above the chair rail will open up the room and it a larger feeling. Chair rails are usually painted a complementary color that offsets the 2 wall colors. Light or dark tones depend on the look you are trying to create.

steps.headline: Paint the walls above and below the chair rail.
steps.description: Allow the walls to dry completely at least 24 to 72 hours before moving on to the next step.

steps.headline: Run painter's tape along the top and bottom edges of the chair rail.
Use a narrow paintbrush or small roller to paint a thin layer of color on to the chair rail.
Allow the paint to dry, and then repeat with thin layers until the desired color and coverage is achieved.
Remove the painter's tape gently from the wall.
Decide the height of the chair rail you wish to create.
steps.description: You may want a chair rail situated at waist height or the height of a chair. Lay a piece of tape on the wall at the height you are considering, and stand back to determine if it is the look you want.

steps.headline: Mask all trim that will not be painted with painter's tape.
Paint the wall a base color.
steps.description: This will end up being the color of the chair rail, so make sure you match it to the color of the other trim in the room. Apply several coats to get the desired coverage you want. Allow the coat of paint to dry completely,.

steps.headline: Measure from the floor up to the desired height and mark the wall with a pencil.
Use a regular or laser level to make a straight line across the wall.
Use painter's tape to cover the area to become the chair rail.
steps.description: An ideal width for a chair rail is 2 inches (5.08 cm). You may use tape the same width, or you can use multiple strips to get the desired width of chair rail.

steps.headline: Paint the upper and lower walls the colors you have chosen.
Remove the painter's tape to reveal the chair rail.
